data.title: Fred Ward, iconic character actor and star of films like #TheRightStuff, #Tremors, and #MiamiBlues has died. He passed away on Sunday,...
data.meta_description:
3,533 likes, 88 comments - indiewire on May 13, 2022: "Fred Ward, iconic character actor and star of films like #TheRightStuff, #Tremors, and #MiamiBlues has died. 

He passed away on Sunday, May 8, as confirmed by his representatives. 

On screens since the early 1970s after serving in the U.S. Air Force and stints as an order cook, boxer, and a lumberjack in Alaska, Ward was known for his versatility in both comic and dramatic roles. The Golden Globe winner was also known for starring in Robert Altman films like #ThePlayer and #ShortCuts.

Ward spent the last years of his life developing his second favorite art form: painting.

More at the link in our bio.".
